intro: Acinodendron elongatum, commonly known as the slender acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Acinodendron elongatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
